meanings.definition: In a way that is based on or characterized by ideals.
meanings.sent1: She always acted idealistically, striving for perfection in everything she did.
meanings.sent2: He approached the project idealistically, aiming to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: Even though it was just a game, she played idealistically, believing in fair play above all.
meanings.sent4: His paintings captured the world idealistically, showing it through a lens of beauty and harmony.
meanings.sent5: The teacher encouraged the students to think idealistically, envisioning a better future for all.

meanings.definition: In a way that is unrealistically or impractically optimistic.
meanings.sent1: She idealistically believed that everything would work out perfectly without any effort.
meanings.sent2: He approached the risky venture idealistically, ignoring the potential challenges ahead.
meanings.sent3: The cat idealistically thought it could catch the laser dot, pouncing on it repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams soared idealistically, reaching heights that reality could never match.
meanings.sent5: The child idealistically thought he could fly if he just believed hard enough.
